intro: Potentilla purpurea, commonly known as the purple cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and have a distinctive five-lobed shape, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." Potentilla purpurea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and attractive addition to gardens.
